_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Midland LPG Terminal Propane Storage and Distribution System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association Code #58 for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the Facility's policy to follow the most current future editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is the Facility's policy to contact the Industry Volunteer Fire Department and the Beaver County Emergency Management Agency, as appropriate, through the 911 Service. The Facility currently maintains a trained incipient stage fire response and first responder-operations level hazardous materials response team to respond to the initial stages of an emergency.



The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Midland LPG Terminal Propane Storage and Distribution System stores propane in above ground storage vessels and offloads cargo trucks at one offload station and loads cargo trucks at 3 loading stations.



The Worst Case and Alternate Case release scenarios were evaluated and communicated to the Industry Volunteer Fire Department. Additionally, the facility maintains an Emergency Response Plan to provide procedures in dealing with product releases.



The Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Midland LPG Terminal Propane Storage and Distribution System complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D- Program Level 3). Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor - Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management regulations (inclusive of all 14 elements) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119).



This Facility has never had an accident or incident involving the Propane Storage and Distribution System resulting in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering-in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Midland LPG Ter

minal Propane Storage and Distribution System, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Industry Volunteer Fire Department and request their assistance. The Facility's Emergency Response Plan is coordinated with the Industry Volunteer Fire Department and the Beaver County Emergency Management Agency. The Industry Volunteer Fire Department is aware of the facility, its safety systems, access points, and protective procedures in the event of a significant release. The Terminal is fully secured

with fencing and controlled access in accordance with its site security plan.



Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety through additional training and drilling and will attempt to include first responders in sessions as applicable.
